      • addTimeSeries

        public int addTimeSeries(int measured_variable_id,
                         java.sql.Timestamp start_time,
                         java.sql.Timestamp end_time,
                         java.lang.Double period,
                         int min_quality,
                         int max_quality)
        Add a row in the time_series table.
        Specified by:
        addTimeSeries in interface Administration
        Parameters:
        measured_variable_id - Measured variable ID.
        start_time - Start time of the time series.
        end_time - End time of the time series.
        period - Period of the time series, expressed in seconds.
        min_quality - Minimum acceptable quality.
        max_quality - Maximum acceptable quality.
        Returns:
        -1 if failure, otherwise ID of the newly created time series.

      • addObservations

        public int addObservations(java.io.File csv_file,
                           java.lang.String measured_variable_name,
                           java.lang.String measured_variable_unit,
                           java.lang.Double period)
        Add observations from a CSV file that contains exactly one time series with the following columns: timestamp, value, quality (in that order). - Automatically create or update a MeasuredVariable row (name and unit). - Automatically create a TimeSeries row with start_date, end_date, min_quality and max_quality derived from the CSV.
        Specified by:
        addObservations in interface Administration
        Parameters:
        csv_file - CSV file with columns: timestamp, value, quality.
        measured_variable_name - Name of the measured variable.
        measured_variable_unit - Unit of the measured variable
        period - Period of the time series, expressed in seconds.
        Returns:
        0 if failure, 1 if success.

                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Add a list of observation rows for a given time series.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        rows - List of observation rows.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs.

        Specified by:
        addConfiguration in interface Administration
        Parameters:
        time_series_id - Time series ID
        aggregation_type - Type of aggregation.
        interval - Aggregation interval in seconds.
        aggregation_table - Aggregation table name.
        Returns:
        0 if failure, 1 if success, 2 if it already exists.
